greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number having at least as many divisors as n.
comment: Similar to A140635, except that a(n) is allowed to have more divisors than n.
a(n) <= n for all n. Moreover, a(n) = n if and only if n belongs to A061799 (or equivalently A002182).
When n is prime, a(n) = 2. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 14 2013
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 16 has 5 divisors; smallest number with at least 5 divisors is 12 with 6 divisors, thus a(16) = 12.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {nd = numdiv(n); for (i=1, n-1, if (numdiv(i) >= nd, return (i));); return (n);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 14 2013
from sympy import divisor_count as d
results.author: _J. Lowell_, May 20 2008
ext: Edited and extended by _Ray Chandler_, May 24 2008
